00001 /**
00002  * @file epapi.h
00003  *
00004  * @date   2009-06-06
00005  * @author Jean-Lou Dupont
00006  *
00007  * @mainpage Documentation for EPAPI - Erlang Port API library -- version $version
00008  *
00009  * This library helps build Erlang Port Drivers - bridging simple
00010  * messages between C/C++ and Erlang. Communication is
00011  * served by a file based pipe (i.e. one "in" and one "out") which
00012  * defaults to "stdin" and "stdout".
00013  *
00014  * \section msg_struc Message Structure
00015  *
00016  * The message format supported follows:
00017  *
00018  *   \code
00019  *   {msg_type, {Message}}
00020  *   \endcode
00021  *
00022  * where <i>msg_type</i> corresponds to an Erlang ATOM and
00023  * <i>Message</i> corresponds to an Erlang TUPLE. The <i>Message</i> tuple
00024  * can be formed of the following primitives:
00025  *
00026  *  \li ATOM
00027  *  \li STRING
00028  *  \li LONG
00029  *  \li DOUBLE
00030  *
00031  *
00032  * \section usage Usage
00033  *
00034  * To send and receive messages, message <i>types</i> must be registered.
00035  * This process is accomplished through the MsgHandler::registerType() method.
00036  *
00037  *   \subsection rx Receiving
00038  *
00039           \code
00040             #include <epapi.h>
00041 
00042                 PktHandler *ph = new PktHandler();
00043                 MsgHandler *mh = new MsgHandler(ph);
00044 
00045                 //Register a message type
00046                 // {echo, {Counter}}
00047                 mh->registerType(1, "echo", "l" );
00048 
00049                 //Wait for a message
00050                 Msg *m;
00051                 result = mh->rx(&m);
00052 
00053                 //Verify return code
00054                 if (result) {
00055                         //handle error
00056                         printf("ERROR, message: %s", mh->strerror());
00057                         // ...
00058                 }
00059                 //Consume message
00060                 ...
00061 
00062                 //Destroy message
00063                 delete m;
00064           \endcode
00065 
00066  *
00067  *   \subsection tx Transmitting
00068  *
00069  *    \code
00070  *     int counter;
00071  *     result =  mh->send(1, counter);
00072  *     // check result
00073  *    \endcode
00074  *
00075  *    \subsection error Error Handling
00076  *
00077  *    All methods return 0 on success and 1 on failure.
00078  *    The error code is available through the get_errno() method,
00079  *    eg.:
00080  *
00081  *    \code
00082  *      MsgHandler *mh;
00083  *      int errnum=mh->get_errno();
00084  *      // ...
00085  *      PktHandler *ph;
00086  *      int errnum=ph->get_errno();
00087  *    \endcode
00088  *
00089  *
00090  *    \subsection erlang Erlang side
00091  *
00092  *    \code
00093 %% Author: Jean-Lou Dupont
00094 %% Created: 2009-06-03
00095 -module(t1).
00096 
00097 %%
00098 %% API
00099 %%
00100 -export([start/0, start/1, stop/0, echo/1]).
00101 
00102 %% internal
00103 -export([init/2, loop/1]).
00104 
00105 %%
00106 %% Local Functions
00107 %%
00108 
00109 echo(X) ->
00110         ?MODULE ! {echo, {X}}.
00111 
00112 start() ->
00113     start("").
00114 
00115 start(Param) ->
00116     spawn_link(?MODULE, init, ["/tmp/decho", Param]).
00117 
00118 stop() ->
00119     ?MODULE ! stop.
00120 
00121 init(ExtPrg, Param) ->
00122     register(?MODULE, self()),
00123     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
00124     Port = open_port({spawn, ExtPrg++" "++Param}, [{packet, 4}, binary, exit_status]),
00125     loop(Port).
00126 
00127 loop(Port) ->
00128     receive
00129 
00130                 {echo,Msg} ->
00131                         {Counter} = Msg,
00132                         BinMsg = {echo, {Counter}},
00133                         io:format("request to send 'echo' message [~p]~n", [BinMsg]),
00134                         erlang:port_command(Port, term_to_binary(BinMsg));
00135 
00136                 stop ->
00137                         io:format("called [stop]"),
00138                         erlang:port_close(Port),
00139                         exit(normal);
00140 
00141                 {Port, {data, Data}} ->
00142                         io:format("Message raw[~p]~n", [Data]),
00143                         Decoded = binary_to_term(Data),
00144                         io:format("Message! Decoded[~p]~n", [Decoded]);
00145 
00146                 Result ->
00147                         Result
00148     end,
00149         loop(Port).
00150  *
00151  *    \endcode
00152  *
00153  * \section releases Releases
00154  *
00155  *  \li 0.1 - Initial Release
00156  *  \li 0.2 - Set the msg_type correctly
00157  *  \li 0.3 - Add TermHandler functionality (required by erlang-dbus)
00158  *  \li 0.5 - BREAKING: packet length=4 only (required by erlang-dbus)
00159  *
00160  *
00161  * \note Only packet header with length field=4 is supported.
00162  */
00163 
00164 #ifndef EPAPI_H_
00165 #define EPAPI_H_

00172 #include <cstring>
00173 #include <strings.h>
00174 
00175 #include <ei.h>
00176 
00177 #ifdef _DEBUG
00178         #include <syslog.h>
00179         void doLog(int priority, const char *message, ...);
00180         #define DBGBEGIN
00181         #define DBGEND
00182         #define DBGMSG(...) printf(__VA_ARGS__)
00183         #define DBGLOG(...) doLog(__VA_ARGS__)
00184         #define DBGLOG_NULL_PTR(ptr, ...) if (NULL==ptr) doLog(__VA_ARGS__)
00185 #else
00186         #define DBGBEGIN if(0){
00187         #define DBGEND   }
00188         #define DBGMSG(...)
00189         #define DBGLOG(...)
00190         #define DBGLOG_NULL_PTR(ptr, ...)
00191 #endif
00192 
00193         /**
00194          * Error codes
00195          */
00196         enum _epapi_error_codes {
00197 
00198                 EEPAPI_OK   = 0,
00199                 EEPAPI_ERR,       //1
00200                 EEPAPI_ERRNO,     //2  client should look-up "errno"
00201                 EEPAPI_NULL,      //3
00202                 EEPAPI_BADINDEX,  //4
00203                 EEPAPI_BADFORMAT, //5
00204                 EEPAPI_MALLOC,    //6
00205                 EEPAPI_REALLOC,   //7
00206                 EEPAPI_NOTFOUND,  //8
00207                 EEPAPI_NEWEIBUF,  //9
00208                 EEPAPI_EIENCODE,  //10
00209                 EEPAPI_EIDECODE,  //11
00210                 EEPAPI_TOOBIG,    //12
00211                 EEPAPI_ARITY,     //13
00212                 EEPAPI_BADTYPE,   //14
00213                 //EEPAPI_,
00214                 //EEPAPI_
00215         };
00216 
00217         class epapiBase {
00218 
00219         public:
00220                 int last_error;
00221 
00222         public:
00223                 static const char *errors[];
00224 
00225                 epapiBase() { last_error=0; };
00226 
00227                 virtual ~epapiBase() {};
00228 
00229                 /**
00230                  * Returns a human readable string
00231                  * corresponding to the last error
00232                  * set in the object instance.
00233                  */
00234                 const char *strerror(void);
00235 
00236                 /**
00237                  * Returns last error
00238                  *
00239                  * @return last_error integer
00240                  */
00241                 int get_errno(void);
00242 
00243         };
00244 
00245         #include "epapi_pkt.h"
00246         #include "epapi_msg.h"
00247         #include "epapi_term.h"
00248 
00249 #endif /* EPAPI_H_ */
